loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de restaurante ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia trabaja desde las 08:00am hasta las 06:00pm,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de aceite,arroz,verduras,carnes entre otros.
La socia esta feliz con el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Cirila continues in the restaurant business, which she has been in for several years now.  Business is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day, working from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She wants to continue working to support her family.

Cirila is requesting a loan to buy oil, rice, vegetables, meat and other items.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy oil, rice, vegetables, meat and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge es un hombre de 44 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su esposo y su hijo de 16 años, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Jorge no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Cau Cau para compartir con su familia. Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace 10 años Jorge trabaja como chofer brindando servicios de colectivo en su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, Jorge puede trabajar por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a los demás. Jorge se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mantenimiento general y la compra de llantas nuevas para su auto, pintado, entre otros; de esta manera Jorge tendrá su auto en mejores condiciones, así podrá seguir brindando sus servicios, con el deseo de poder lograr su gran de tener su propia empresa de transporte y así brindarle una profesión a su hijo.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 44-year-old man. He lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago, with his wife and his 16-year-old son, whom he loves and who are his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who puts all his effort into helping his family get ahead. Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources and because he had to work from a very young age, Jorge could not study Civil Engineering as he wished to. In his free time he likes to watch educational programs on TV and he occasionally makes a delicious Cau Cau [tripe stew] to share with his family. 

By his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Jorge has worked as a driver for ten years, offering taxi services in his city. He works every day from the early hours of the morning and he goes around the streets of the city in search of passengers. Jorge can work for approximately ten hours and he believes it is going well because of the kindness he shows to others. 

Jorge is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to do general maintenance on his car and buy paint and new tires for it, among other things. Jorge’s car will be in better condition and he will be able to continue offering his services. He wants to be able to achieve his great dream of having his own transportation business and thereby having a profession to pass on to his son.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his car, and buy tires and paint, among other things

loans.name: Wilbert Isaias

texts.es:
El socio continua dedicandose a brindar el servicio de movilidad,el socio cuenta con una combi donde hace servicio de movilidad,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia  a su negocio,el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para realizar el mantenimiento de su combi.

El socio  está contento con el crédito otorgado y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
Wilbert Isaias is still working in transportation, using his minivan to provide service.  He has been in business for several years now and it is going well for him thanks to the hard work he puts into it every day.  He wants to continue working to support his family.

He is requesting a loan to pay for maintenance for his vehicle.  He is happy about the loan and grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Elsa Eulogia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO",el banco está situado en el distrito de San Jeronimo,provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Elsa tiene 47 años de edad es casada y tiene 04 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de panes, la socia elabora panes para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, manteca entre otros para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to communal bank “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo” (“The Lionesses of San Jerónimo”). The bank is located in the district of San Jerónimo, in the province and department of Cusco. 

The member, Elsa, is 47 years old and married with four children. The member alternates her daily activities with the business of making bread. The member makes bread to sell to customers who ask for it. The member has spent some time in this business, which brings her economic and personal satisfaction. The member wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

The member is requesting the loan in order to purchase supplies, such as flour and butter, among other things, for her business.

The member feels grateful for the loan and promises to make the set repayments.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, such as flour and butter, among other things, for her business

loans.name: Maritza Alejandrina

texts.es:
Maritza es una joven de 22 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, ella es una joven con un carisma contagiante, asimismo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, ya que trabaja desde muy temprano en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad como obrera. Con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a su madre con los gastos del hogar, ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo le pone muchas ganas en todo lo que hace.

Maritza agradeceré el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar una cocina a gas, ya que actualmente su cocina es de Kerosene y en algunas oportunidades su madre ha tenido algunos accidentes debido a ello; así Maritza podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguirá luchando y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria y poder tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Maritza, 22, lives in the city of Ica, district of Parcona.  She is a young woman with a contagious charisma and is determined to get ahead.  Very early in the morning she begins her work as a hired hand on a farm in her city.  With the income she earns she helps her mother cover household expenses.  Things are going well for her, she believes, because she is responsible, and above all, makes every effort to do a good job.

Maritza is grateful for the support from Kiva lenders because thanks to them she can buy a gas stove and can get rid of the kerosene stove they have.  Sometimes her mother has had accidents with the kerosene one, and Maritza wants to give her family a better quality of life.  She will continue struggling and working to achieve her goal: "To get a university degree and have her own business".

loans.use: To buy a gas stove.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO",el banco está situado en el distrito de San Jeronimo,provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Martin tiene 55 años de edad es casado y tiene 04 hijos, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando como maestro de obra para las distintas obras que solicitan sus servicios, él socio lleva años ejerciendo este su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas para su trabajo como taladros.
EL socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to communal bank “The Lionesses of San Jerónimo”. The bank is situated in the district of San Jerónimo, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member, Martin, is 55 years old and married with four children. The member alternates his daily activities with working as a foreman on the different jobs where his services are requested. The member has been doing this job for years and it is going well thanks to the effort he puts into his work every day. The member wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting his family.

The member is requesting the loan in order to purchase tools for his work, such as drills.

The member feels grateful for the loan and promises to make the set repayments.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his work, such as drills

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO",el banco está situado en el distrito de San Jeronimo,provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Valerio tiene 61 años de edad es casado y tiene 04 hijos, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una empresa publica, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo a la vez el socio se dedica a la crianza de animales menores conjuntamente con su esposa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
EL socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Valerio belongs to the 'Las Leonas de San Jerónimo' community bank which is located in San Jeronimo district, in Cusco province, Cusco department.

61-year-old Valerio is married and has four children.  He works for a public company.  He has been working in his job for a long time and is doing well thanks to the hard work that he puts in every day.  Valerio also raises animals together with his wife.  This is how he gets his family ahead in life. 

Valerio is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs for his business.  He is grateful for the loan he is receiving and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for his business

loans.name: Sunico

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO", el banco está situado en el distrito de San Jeronimo, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Sunico tiene 23 años de edad es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Sunico is a member of 'Las Leonas de San Jerónimo' community bank which is located in San Jerónimo district, in Cusco province and department.

Sunico is 23 years old and lives with her partner.  Her business is raising animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She has been in her business for some time and it is going well thanks to the hard work that she puts in every day.  Sunico raises her animals and then sells them to customers who ask her for them.  This is how she is making progress in life.

Sunico is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.  She feels grateful for the loan she is receiving and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business

loans.name: Sonia Mercedes

texts.es:
Sonia de 41 años de edad es madre de dos hijos, se dedica a la actividad de las confecciones hace alrededor de 30 años. El taller se encuentra ubicado en su casa. Se dedica principalmente a la confección de sudaderas, pijamas y camisetas. Los clientes potenciales son sus familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector. 
Sonia desea comprar insumos como telas, hilos, bandas y elásticos para la elaboración de sus prendas lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Su mayor sueño es tener una buena rentabilidad y convertirse en una fuente de empleo directa para la región.
texts.en:
41-year-old Sonia is the mother of two children.  She has been working as a seamstress for around 30 years.  Her workshop is located in her home.  Sonia  mainly makes sweatshirts, pajamas and t-shirts.  Her potential customers are family members, friends and neighbors.

Sonia would like to buy supplies such as fabric, threads, bands and elastic for making her garments.  This will allow her to improve her income and provide her family with a better quality of life.  Her biggest dream is to make good profits and become a source of direct employment in her region.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, bands and elastic

loans.name: Ilsy Damary

texts.es: Ilsy, tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive con ellos y su esposo en una aldea del municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Ella realiza su propia actividad de negocio desde hace 4 años, donde vende productos cosméticos como cremas, lociones, champú, desodorantes y otros. Ademas realiza trabajos de confección de ropa y venta de ropa. El producto de cosmetico lo vende de manera ambulante y según pedido del cliente. Ha decidido por un préstamo de 6,000 lempiras para comprar cosméticos como lociones, cremas,champú y ropa para surtir el negocio y satisfacer a sus clientes. Su deseo es crecer con el negocio para obtener más ganancias y tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ilsy is 32 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives with her children and husband in the small village of Arizona, Atlántida.  She has been running her own business for four years selling cosmetics such as creams, lotions, shampoo, deodorants and other products.  She also makes and sells clothing.  Ilsy sells her cosmetics door to door, according to her customers' orders.  She has decided to take out a loan for 6,000 lempiras to buy cosmetics such as lotions, creams and shampoo, and clothing so that she can stock her business and keep her customers happy.  Her goal is to grow her business so that she can make more profits and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as lotions, creams and shampoo, and clothing

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Don Andrés,  tiene 52 años de edad, esta soltero, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. El, toda su vida se ha  dedicado al comercio, tiene varios años de vender mercadería en general en su casa. Vende sandalias, cosméticos, talcos, presto barba, jabón de baño, papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, champú, cremas, etc. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos al que le dedica todo el tiempo necesario. Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar productos y surtir el negocio como ser: sandalias, cosméticos, productos de aseo e higiene. El préstamo le ayudara a incrementar las ventas  y los ingresos. Su meta es ampliar el mercado para incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Andrés is 52 years old, single, and lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes.  He has been buying and selling stuff his whole life and has been selling general merchandise from his home for a number of years.  Andrés sells sandals, cosmetics, talcum powder, disposable razors, bath soap, toilet paper, sanitary towels, shampoo, creams, etc.  This business is his source of income and he puts all the time he needs to into it.

Andrés has decided to request a second loan for 20,000 lempiras to buy products and stock his business.  He will buy sandals, cosmetics, personal care products and personal hygiene products.  This loan will help him to increase his sales and his income.  His goal is to expand his market so that he can increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy sandals, cosmetics, personal care products and personal hygiene products

loans.name: Lorena Araceli

texts.es: Lorena, tiene 45 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene dos hijas y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Hace 4 años ella inicio su propio negocio de confección de ropa, compra y venta de ropa de cama, manteles de meza, cortinas, blusas y otros. La venta es realizada de manera ambulante y en el mercado. Ha mantenido el negocio mediante la obtención de varios préstamos, en ODEF lleva siete ciclos con el actual el cual es por 6,000 Lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de ropa de cama, manteles de meza y cortinas para poder cumplirle a sus clientes. Su plan es mantener en crecimiento el negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y dar bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Lorena is 45 years old and lives with her common law husband. She has two daughters and lives in a village in the area of Arizona, Atlántida. 

She started her own business 4 years ago. Her business involves making clothes, buying and selling bedclothes, tablecloths, curtains, blouses, etc.  The sales are made on a mobile basis and at the market. 

She has kept the business going by obtaining several loans. This is her seventh cycle with ODEF. The loan is for 6,000 Lempiras, which she will invest in the purchase of bedclothes, tablecloths and curtains in order to meet her customers’ demands. Her plan is to continue to grow the business in order to obtain better earnings and improve her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase bedclothes, tablecloths and curtains in order to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: David Edison

texts.es:
David es un hombre de 28 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, David no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cantar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, David trabaja como vendedor en una empresa de electrodomésticos de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
David se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindad podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea cercar la parte trasera de su casa con materiales resistentes y seguros, de esta manera David seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
David is a single man of 28, who lives in the city of Ica.  He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who devotes all his energy to getting by.  Unfortunately, as money was tight and he had to work from a very young age, David was unable to study Business Administration as he would have liked.  

In his free time, he likes singing and occasionally cooks a delicious Seco de Pollo (chicken stew) to share with his family.  David is employed as a salesman in a household appliance shop, where he works on his own initiative and with tremendous effort and commitment.  He works for about 10 hours every day and believes that he is successful because of the way he performs his duties and the friendly way in which he treats others.  

David is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, with their help, he can improve his home by fencing in the back of his house with resistant and secure materials.  David will, therefore, continue to work and strive to realise his great ambition of being successful in his work.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Javier Jesus

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Javier no pudo estudiar la carrera militar que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Javier trabaja como agente de seguridad en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Javier se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar esteras, caña Guayaquil, madera y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para refaccionar el techado y otras partes de su vivienda, de esta manera él y su familia contaran con un ambiente mas adecuado y seguro, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Javier is a 22-year-old man, is single, and lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to overcome. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources and because of the necessity he had to work from a very young age, Javier was not able to study for the military career that he wanted. In his free time he likes to listen to music and sometimes he cooks a delicious Arroz con Pollo [chicken and rice dish] to share with his family.

Of his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Javier works as a security guard at a commercial business in his city. He works every day and can do so for approximately 12 hours. He feels pleased doing his job and he thinks it is going well because he is responsible and because he treats others in a friendly manner.

Javier is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help provided he will be able to improve his home. He wants to buy mats woven from reeds, bamboo rods, wood and other things, which will serve to repair the roof and other parts of his home. In this way, he and his family will have a more appropriate and secure environment. He will thus keep working and making an effort to achieve his great dream of having his own home.

loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadia est une femme mariée de 36 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui vit avec son èpoux et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Centre de la ville de Bougouni. 
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école moderne très vite elle commença à mener des activités génératrices des revenus. C’est ainsi qu’elle décida de suivre sa sœur pour apprendre l’activité d’achat et de vente d’arachide. 
Nantie de  plusieurs années d’expériences, elle maitrise cette activité dans laquelle elle est très sollicitée et appréciée. 
Après un prêt solidaire dans une association de femmes  de son quartier, qui fut correctement remboursé, elle décide de venir au prêt individuel et elle est à son premier prêt individuel qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 400 kg d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Bougouni  auprès des paysans producteurs. La vente se fait à la maison et au marché, en détail au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle constituée essentiellement de consommateurs. 
Elle envisage réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour aider son époux à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en: Mrs Kadia is a married woman, 35 years old, and the mother of six children who lives with her husband and their children in the Hérémakono Centre neighborhood of the city of Bougouni. She did not attend school, and from an early age, became involved in income-generating activities. She followed her sister, and both are now involved in the purchase and sales of peanuts. She is now recognized and respected for this activity, which she has been doing for several years. Subsequent to a loan provided by an association of women in her neighborhood, which was successfully reimbursed, she is asking for her first individual loan in order to purchase 400 kg of peanuts. She stocks up in neighboring villages from local farmers, and sell the proucts from her home or at th market, individually or wholesale, and often for credit, to a customer base largely composed of consumers. She hopes this loan will allow her to achieve monthly profits of 30 000 FCFA (approximately 60 USD) that she will use to help her husband take care of the family expenses, to reimburse the loan, and to reinvest in her commercial activity.

loans.use: purchase peanut paste

loans.name: Nueva Vision Group

texts.es:
Rosa  es integrante de la alcancía Nueva Visión

Rosa  es casada tiene 02 hijos ambos son estudiantes,  uno de ellos está en la universidad. Rosa los apoya para que continúen estudiando  gracias a su trabajo puede costear algunos gastos que ellos requieren, hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y lencería, durante todo este tiempo ha ganado muchos clientes  quienes le compran diversos productos como perfumería, maquillaje, bijouteria y lencería. Con el préstamo solicitado podrá abastecerse de mercadería y así poder ofrecer a su clientela variedad, quiere aprovechas que se avecina el día de la madre donde las ventas son muy buenas. Rosa esta agradecida por sus préstamos que le permiten ayudar a sus hijos, su mayor sueño en la vida es terminar la construcción de su casa y poner un negocio.
A los inversores de KIVA les quiere decir ¡Muchas gracias! Por apoyarla a ella y su grupo comunal.
Rosa es la segunda de la izquierda tiene blusa blanca.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the communal bank Nueva Visión [New Vision]. She is married and has two children; both are students and one goes to the university. Rosa supports their studies and thanks to her job, she can pay for some of the expenses they have. She has sold beauty products and lingerie for twelve years and has many customers, who buy all kinds of products from her: perfumes, makeup, imitation jewelry and lingerie.

With the loan she requested, she will be able to buy merchandise to offer more variety to her customers. She wants to take advantage of mother’s day, when sales are very good. Rosa is grateful for the loans she has received, because they help her support her children. Her biggest dream in life is to finish building her house and start a business.

She wants to say Thank you! to Kiva lenders, for supporting her and her communal bank. Rosa is sitting second, left to right, wearing a white blouse.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes and lingerie.

loans.name: Soumaila

texts.fr:
Monsieur Soumaila est un homme marié de 36 ans et père de 1 enfant qui vit avec sa femme et son enfant,  chez son père  à Bougouni, dans le 
Après l’école coranique, Soumaila décida de partir en Libye à la recherche d’une vie meilleure. Ses rêves n’ont pas été réalisés, alors il  retourner au pays précisément à Bougouni, où auprès de son oncle,  il décide d’apprendre le commerce d’animaux  boeufs, moutons, chèvres, etc.
Dans le but de  renforcer son pouvoir d’achat, il décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son 3 eme prêt, après avoir correctement remboursé les deux prêts précédents. 
Ce nouveau prêt  sera  utiliser  pour acheter 3 boeufs. Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et environs et la vente se fait à la maison et au marché à bétail de Bougouni. Ses clients sont pour la plus part des bouchers. 
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000 FCFA qui servira à contribuer dans les dépenses de la famille et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en: Mr Soumaila is a married 36 year old man and the father of one child, who lives with this wife and child in his father's house in Bougouni. After attending Koranic school, Soumaila dedided to move to Libya in search of a better life. His dreams were never realized, and he returned to his country and was taught by his uncle how to buy and sell animals such as ox, sheep, goats, etc. He decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to reinforce his purchasing power, and is currently asking for his third loan, after having successfuly reimbursed the previous two. This loan will allow him to purchase three ox. He stocks up on animals around Bougouni and sells them either from his home or at the city's cattle market. His clients are mostly butchers. He hopes this loan will allow him to gain a monthly profit of 70 000 FCFA (approximately 140 USD) which he will use to cover his family's expenses and reinvest in his commercial activity.

loans.use: purchase ox

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: El señor Luis Carlos  de 54 años de edad  esta casado con la Sra. Alicia de 56 años . el señor Luis se dedica a la Venta de Paletas, Galletas, Dulces de leche y más variedad de  dulces  tiene 5 años que se dedica  a dicha Venta; el trai su propia  ruta para salir a las tienditas de la localidad a ofrecer  los dulces  que el vende a precio de mayoreo comenta que tiene alrededor de 15 clientes que son seguros  que le compran  y le encargan mercancia  2 o 3 dias a la semana   pero el  propósito del Sr. Luis  es  comprar un poco de todo,  hay cosas que sus  clientes le  piden y no las  trai  en existencia,  así  que va perdiendo  clientes  ya que tienen que   surtir  en  otra parte,   le gustaría   tener  más  variedad   en su  mercancía ,  es por eso que  el  dia de hoy  esta solicitando el credito para  comprar todo lo que le hace falta y así  tendrá   mas  clientes  y  por lo tanto mas ingresos y asi podra  dar  un mejor servicio a sus clientes. .
texts.en:
Luis Carlos is fifty-four years old and is married to Alicia, who is fifty-six years old.  Luis makes a living selling lollipops, cookies, dulce de leche candies and other varieties of sweets.  He has been in this business for five years.  He makes his own routes in order to sell away from the small stores in town; he offers and sells the sweets at a wholesale price.  He says that he has about fifteen regular customers that buy and order his merchandise two or three days a week. 

Luis makes sure to buy a little of everything, and there are things that his clients request that he does not sell.  Therefore, he ends up losing clients, since they are able to find these supplies in other areas.  

He would like to have more variety in his merchandise.  This is the reason that he is requesting a loan.  He will buy everything that he is missing and will therefore have more clients and a higher income.  He will be able to provide a better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is an Iraqi client who is 42 years old, married and is a father of two children. 

Haydar is the sole provider of the family. He owns a shop where he sells lumber blocks. These blocks are used for building construction. During the construction of a building, they put cement on stone blocks and use these wooden blocks to maintain the balance of the constructed building until the cement is hardened. 

Haydar gained his experience through working at a similar shop for several years as an employee. In 2003, he established his own business and now he has two employees. He is well-known in his surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Haydar is requesting a loan of $1,000 to increase his lumber inventory. He believes that this loan will positively affect the growth of his business and Haydar will easily be able to provide his family’s needs and provide them better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his lumber inventory.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani is from Yerevan. She is married and lives with her husband and his family.

Ani is taking her master's degree at Yerevan State University and now is in her second course. As she is very hardworking and studies very well, she works at the same university as an assistant.

Ani applied for a loan to SEF International in order to pay her tuition fee of the first semester. Now, with a good credit history behind her, she has applied for her second loan.

Ani needs the loan to pay for her university tuition fee of the second semester. It is very important for Ani to complete her education and get a master's degree.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition fee of the second semester.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah, now a mother of three, has successfully paid her previous loan owing to good prices of farm produce in the season. She has started a poultry business out of the farm produce.

Stellah has been advanced a second loan of KES 20,000, which will enable her to buy chicks for rearing and also buy farm inputs. She will use the proceeds to put up a larger house for her poultry.

She hopes raise a well educated family and to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and farm inputs.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Letecia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell to her customers.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to buy a refrigerator for the storage of her soft-drinks.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tahzeem

texts.en:
Tahzeem is a 33-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her family. She is a mother of seven children. 

She owns a small embroidery business in her house. Her embroidery items are liked by everyone. Currently, her stock of embroidery material is almost finished. Therefore she is interested to purchase a variety of embroidery materials including colourful threads, beads, stones, needles and fabric. For that purpose, Tahzeem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that the loan will be productive for her business. 

With the profit amount, she wants to construct her own house. She hopes that she will earn sufficient profit so that she could easily pay back the loan amount as well as construct her house. She is feeling very happy after taking the loan because this will help her to fulfill her needs.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery supplies.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter is 51 years old. She lives in the small village of the Khelvachauri district with her son. 

Eter has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-ups, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, they have 0.3 hectare plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. They sell the harvested products locally.  It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Eter requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Eter has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With this credit, Eter will renovate a two-room flat for renting. After the flat is renovated, Eter will rent it out and increase the income of her family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to renovate a flat for renting.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn makes her living through a farming business owned by her family. She is 43 years old, married and has two children. She helps her spouse manage a hectare cornfield which they plant and harvest to sell. The couple has been in the business for over 10 years now. 

She still hopes for better crop production, and that is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to invest in the farm. She will buy eight bags of UREA (fertilizer) and pesticides used in farming. This will help maintain good growth of crops and enable her to harvest it profitably. 

Good crop production will lead to good income and someday achieve a better way of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy eight bags of fertilizer and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 36 years old, married, and has four children. She is a farmer in Limuru and sells her produce (potatoes, kale, and maize) to the local residents. Lucy has been in this business for seven years, earning 30,000 KES a month.

Lucy is requesting her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to buy seedlings, fertilizer, etc. In the future, she wants to be a successful large scale farmer.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seedlings, etc.

loans.name: Exiquila

texts.en:
Exiquila is married and has six children. She works hard to support her family. She sells dried fish in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from fishing.  

Exiquila is requesting her fifth loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of dried fish to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 38 years old, married and blessed with three children whom he supports. He has been running a retail shop for the last four years, getting a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

With a loan of KES 40,000 from KADET Ltd., he plans to restock his shop with a variety of consumable products such as flour, crates of milk, sugar and candies for sale.

The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into business for expansion as well as purchase of a posho mill. His future dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy consumables for his retail shop such as flour, crates of milk, sugar and candies.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser, a 26-year-old youth client from Iraq, is married and lives with his family, which consists of three members. Naser and his father provide the family's income.

Naser owns a small garage and specializes in repairing motorcycles and selling their spare parts. With a passion for motorcycles since his childhood, he spent most of his time at a friend’s garage aiming to learn more about motorcycles. In 2010, Naser established his own business and opened his own garage. He has earned an excellent reputation and now has one employee.

Naser is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 to install an external ceiling and a rolling shutter. Naser is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he can take better care of both his parents and his wife and provide for all of their needs.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling and a rolling shutter

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a single lady of forty-five, a mother of three children. She is a farmer in Limuru and has been in this business for eight years. She gets a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Eunice's second loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings, etc. In future she wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: To buy animal feed, seedlings, etc

loans.name: Amina Group

texts.en:
Amina, a responsible and hard working 43-year-old housewife and mother of six, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. Her husband is a brick seller who purchases bricks to sell for profit in the market. This small business is the only source of income for the family.

As a member of a two-person lending group, Amina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband purchase more bricks to sell. This will enable him to increase his net income and savings for the future. He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for his business. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

NOTE : In the picture Amina is shown raising her hand

loans.use: To purchase bricks

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of two young  children from Tagbilaran, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than three years now. This is the source of her income. 

Everline is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her business and make it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Jolina

texts.en:
Jolina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jolina is 43 years old and has four children who are in school.

Jolina has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Jolina has been in this business for two years.  In the future, Jolina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additonal ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
This is Liza. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Liza hopes that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, and beverages with which to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Jahira

texts.en:
Jahira is 44 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school, Jahira works very hard to provide for them.

Jahira runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Jahira has been in this business for five years.

In the future Jahira would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir, who is 29 years old, is a married youth client from Iraq who has a single child. Samir is the sole provider of his family.

Samir owns a small shop where he sells men's outfits. He established his business in 2009 and has gained good experience in this field. He now has hired an employee and has gained an excellent reputation, thanks to the good quality and the affordable prices of his products.

Samir is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 which will be used to install a display window, a rolling shutter and signage for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to educate his child and provide him a bright future.

loans.use: to install a display window, a rolling shutter and signage for his shop

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a talented Egyptian Albanian musician who plays instruments like the mandolin, the guitar, and the organ. He and his wife, along with other musicians, have been part of a musical group for eight years now. They are called to play at special events in their community and in other communities. In addition to this, Andrea and his wife are involved in agricultural activities. They plant wheat, onions, and potatoes on the land they own then sell their fresh produce to wholesale buyers.

Andrea is a 37-year-old married father of two school-aged children, a ten-year-old and a six-year-old. The family lives in southern Albania. 

This loan will be Andrea’s first loan. He will use it to buy potato seeds.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds to plant

loans.name: Joreta

texts.en:
This is Joreta. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Joreta hopes to expand her business and dreams of having their own house. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 47 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. Maribeth is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
This is Lorena. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy tools and supplies used in her manicure and pedicure business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy tools and supplies. She also sells palm wine. Profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lorena dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tools and supplies to use in her manicure and pedicure business, like a manicure bowl, nail polish, tweezers and nippers.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en: Jona is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of a nine-year-old son from Panglao, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. Jona is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds for the pigs. Through this, she will be able to improve her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma peacefully lives at Alcala with her husband, and they have three grown up children. Vilma and her spouse are farmers. They grow corn to sell to traders. Through their income from farming, they are able to sustain the needs of the family. 

Vilma is now asking for a loan to keep sustaining her crops with farm supplies. She is asking for P50,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticide to use in farming. This will be a great help in making the crops healthier. 

With hard work and perseverance, Vilma will acquire an abundant harvest and become a successful corn grower. This will enable her to achieve financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticide to sustain her corn crop.

loans.name: Crissil

texts.en:
Crissil works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. In the future, Crissil would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 32 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by fishing in the Philippines. She has had her fishing business for 8 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy wood, paints, nails, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy wood, paints, nails, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Xhafer

texts.en:
Xhafer is a 29-year-old Egyptian Albanian who is a married father of a 5-year-old. He is talented with mechanical skills. The majority of men in his Egyptian community are talented with and practice such skills, and some own auto shops. 

Living in a large city in southern Albania, Xhafer found out that there was a need for an auto shop, and he opened his some five years back. Since then he has been doing fine, according to him.

The loan that Xhafer is requesting now will help him buy new tires for replacing clients’ tires as well as other necessary tools for his profession.

loans.use: To buy new tires for replacing clients' tires as well as necessary tools for his profession.

loans.name: Susuana

texts.en:
Susuana, 47 years old, has been a trader for seven years. She sells school uniforms. She deals directly with school administrations in the sale of her products. She covers some of her household's expenses with the earnings that she receives. 

She lives in her own house with her two children, aged 17 and 22 years. 

Susuana is asking for a loan amount of 1,300 GHS (Ghana cedis) that will allow her to buy more school uniforms and kids' wear at wholesale prices and sell them to schools. 

In this way, she will be able to obtain a better income from her sales and give her children everything they need with no limitations.

loans.use: To buy enough uniforms to sell to schools.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is a 59-year-old married woman and a mother of three grown-up children from Panglao, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 30 years with her husband.
 
Prudencia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. In the future, Prudencia dreams of expanding their fishing business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets.

loans.name: Toufic

texts.en:
Toufic is a 23-year-old Lebanese man. He’s single and living with his parents and two working siblings. His father is the main source of income for the family. 

Toufic is a great man who loves his family and really wants to offer them a respectable life; this is the reason why he’s working nonstop, on his own, to be able to take some responsibilities off of his father. He’s specialized in installing solar-energy systems. He’s an honest man and above all punctual, which is what make his customers loyal to him. 

Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase new tools and solar equipment. This Kiva loan will facilitate his business operations and increase his sales. This is how Toufic works to collect higher revenues and will help his family live a very comfortable life from hard work.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and solar-energy system equipment.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is an industrious man and a loving father to his child. He is 22 years old and a farmer, planting and harvesting corn to sell. He has been in the business for two years now and earns just enough income to sustain his family's needs and to have revolving capital in the business. 

He hopes to increase his crop production, and for that goal he is asking for P40,000 to buy farm supplies (urea, pesticides and insecticides) to use in farming. In the future, Jeffrey hopes to become a successful corn grower and attain a progressive life for his family, especially for the welfare of his child.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies (urea, pesticides and insecticides) to use in farming.

loans.name: Madres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Ofelia de 42 años es integrante de la alcancía Madres Emprendedoras. Ella es madre de 03 hijos al ser madre soltera tiene que trabajar muy duro para darle a sus hijos lo necesario. Ofelia se dedica principalmente a la venta de comidas son aproximadamente 09 años que se dedica a este negocio y lo aprendió gracias a su hermano que también se dedica a lo mismo, el negocio está ubicado en su casa, allí prepara diversos alimentos para vender menú principalmente a los trabajadores de la zona quienes acuden a su negocio para comprarle comida, por otro lado ha incursionado en la venta de productos de belleza y ropa, el dinero de su préstamo lo utilizara para alquilar un puesto en un mercado de su zona donde iniciara su negocio. Ofelia esta agradecida por este préstamo que le permite cumplir su sueño y espera seguir en EDAPROSPO por muchos años.
Ofelia aparece en la foto con buzo color negro y polo morado.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 42 years old and is a member of the 'Madres Emprendedoras' ['Entrepreneurial Mothers'] group of borrowers. She is the mother of 3 children; being a single mother she has to work very hard to give her children what they need. Ofelia makes a living primarily from selling food. For approximately 9 years she has made a living from this business and she learned it thanks to her brother who also works in this business. 

The business is located in her house; she prepares various foods there and sells her menu primarily to workers in the area who come to her business to buy food. She has also ventured into the sale of beauty products and clothing. The money from her loan will be used to rent a space in a market in her area where she can start her business.  Ofelia is grateful for this loan, as it allows her to fulfill her dream, and she hopes to continue with EDAPROSPO for many years.

Ofelia appears in the photo with the black jogging suit and purple shirt.

loans.use: to rent a space for her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
This is Jane. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used for the maintenance of her washing machines. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan for the maintenance of her washing machines. She also sells rice retail and she will also use the money to buy sacks of rice. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jane dreams that her businesses will continue to expand and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her washing machines.

loans.name: Matormah

texts.en:
Matormah is 38 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married with five children between 4 and 22 years old. All of them live at home and only two attend school. Matormah was unfortunate and unable to attend school.  

She has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market for eight years. She started this business when she thought of being able to do something for herself, and learned this trade from her mother. She spends ten hours a day, six days a week with her business.

Matormah is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, coal, oil, pepper, fish, bush-meat, etc. for her business. Her future plan is to educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, coal, oil, pepper, fish, bush-meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Surat Group

texts.en:
Surat is a 40-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and five daughters. Since 2004, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop and usually sells his vegetables in the central market. He always sells fresh vegetables and his clients are satisfied with his rates. 

Surat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan investment, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. Her husband is a very hardworking and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

NOTE: In the picture Surat is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fresh vegetables.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a friendly and kind woman. She’s from Lebanon and is 54 years old. She’s divorced and living with her only parent and siblings. Ghada and her youngest brother are working really hard to provide the family with the needed income. Since she noticed that their income does not satisfy their needs, she decided to start her own business. She sells a wide variety of sportswear and sports equipment from which she earns a fair amount of money daily. 

To better develop her work, she’s requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more merchandise for her business. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and thus, improve her income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 29 years old and has three children. Amer works hard to provide for his family’s needs, working in his grocery store while his wife takes care of their children. In his grocery store, Amer offers to provide all the basic needs of a family like dairy products, juices, canned food, snacks, shampoos and detergents. He established his business in 2011 and has gained all the needed experience through previously working at a similar grocery store for several years. Amer now has an employee hired and has gained good fame in his neighborhood thanks to the good quality and competitive prices of his offered goods.

Amer is requesting a youth loan of $2,100. He will use this loan to renovate his grocery store to attract more customers. Amer believes that this loan will positively effect the improvement of his business and his profits, so he will be able to provide his children with better living standards.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store.

loans.name: Maisha Group

texts.fr: La cliente Naweza est une conseillère  du  groupement d’affaire Maisha, entrepreneur,  âgée de 45  ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Son conjoint est un modéliste couturier. La cliente est vendeuse des souliers. Elle étale ses marchandises au long de la rue.  Elle commença cette affaire avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima.  Il ya environs 2 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  50 paires de souliers à marchander. L’insécurité, la crise financière  sont de défis majeurs pour son activité. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison. In fine, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit. Il sied de signaler que, une cliente porte son bébé au dos.
texts.en: Naweza is a member and advisor of the Maisha business group. She is a 45 year old entrepeneur and is married and mother to eight children. Her husband is a designer and dressmaker. Naweza sells shoes on the roadside. She started this business with a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been trading shoes for around 2 years. This new loan will enable her to buy 50 pairs of shoes that she can sell. The biggest challenges for her businessy are lack of security and the financial crisis. She wants to increase her capital, educate her children and build a house. Ultimately, she would like to thank Hekima for supporting her through microcredit. It should be noted that one member of the group has a baby on her back.

loans.use: to buy 50 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is applying for a loan to support his studies for a year at the MERU. This is his story:

I'm from Chiawelo, in Soweto. I am studying at the Maharishi Institute for a Bachelor's Degree in Management, specialising in Nature Conservation and Sustainable Living. 

In my spare time, I enjoy cooking and eating, as well as football, singing, reading, watching movies and making money. At our campus at Ezemvelo Nature Reserve, I work as the cook for the students and staff. Both my parents are not working and I have two brothers and a sister. Only one of them goes to the University of Johannesburg. 

I plan to graduate by 2014 and want to work for a big South African company, for no more than 10 years. During this time, I want to save money to start my own businesses in food and property. These businesses that will enable me to start more businesses.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is applying for a loan to support his studies for a year at the MERU. This is his story:

My name is Charles, I am studying for a Bachelor 's Degree in Management and specialising in Nature Conservation and Sustainable Living at the Maharishi Institute. I'm 33 and origionaly from Ogies in Mpumalanga.

My mother divorced my father when I was 7 months old and she has brought me and my two siblings up alone. My sister (first born) is attending the University of Pretoria and I have a son who is attending Grade 1 at Sukumani Primary School. In my spare time I listen to the radio, read economics, spiritual and political books.

I plan to graduate by December 2014. After graduation, I would like to be a Nature Conservationist at Ezemvelo Nature Reserve and part time Stock Exchange Investor. I would like to get married, build a home for us, and give my child a better future than mine.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Ayanda

texts.en:
Ayanda is applying for a loan to support his studies for a year at the MERU. This is his story:

I'm from Orange Farm in Johannesburg. I'm studying for a Bachelor`s Degree in Management, specialising in Nature Conservation and Sustainable Living at the Maharishi Institute.

I am the first born in a family of seven. I have three brothers, a little sister and both parents. I come from an underprivileged family. My brother finished high school last year, and doesn`t have funds to attend a college. My two little brothers and a sister are still at school. I love making music and in my free time, I read literature and write poetry.

After my graduation in 2014, I want to run a sustainable eco-friendly business, focusing on eco-tourism and agricultural renewable energy. I would also like to teach kids and communities about human impact in the modern environment and sustainability.

My long-term goals are to work in environmental management, be a businessman in 5 -10 years, and lastly establish community projects focusing on economic growth and environmental education.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
Yassah is 24 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest production area of rubber plantations in Liberia. She is single with three children between 16 months and 7 years old; all of them live at home and only two attend school. She stopped her education at grade 5.

She has been selling slippers in the local market for the past two years, and she started this business with money given to her by her mother to help herself. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. Her future plan is to go back to school and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 43-year-old hardworking and diligent women. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and three sons. Her husband and all of her sons are running a car decoration and accessories shop. This is the only source of income for her family. Currently, they are facing many problems in business as the current stock of car accessories is almost finished, and they have no funds available to purchase more stock. 

Shaheen has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can continue his business and purchase a new variety of car accessories and decoration kits like car chargers, fog lights, seat covers, neon lights, MP3 and DVD players, etc. With the profit amount, she is going to make arrangements for the marriage of her son and for the expansion of their business.

She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them, and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

Note: In the picture, Shaheen is carrying a passbook in hand.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a car-accessories shop.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en: Wael is 19 years old from Gaza. He owns a shop for mobile selling and has been maintaining it since 2011. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy an electricity generator, display stands and some mobile phones for his mobile shop. Wael hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy an electricity generator, display stands and some mobile phones for his mobile shop.

loans.name: Watchoee

texts.en: Watchoee is 46 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County. Margibi County is the highest producer of rubber in Liberia. She is single with 8 children between the ages of 15 and 30 years old, of which only one of them lives at home and attends school. Watchoee was unfortunately unable to attend school. She has been selling items such as toothpaste, soap, hair-grease etc in her local market for the past ten years. She started this business with money given to her by her brother to help herself. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more stocks of toothpaste, soap, hair-grease etc for her business. Her future plan is to educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of toothpaste, soap, hair-grease etc for her business.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 32 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber plantations in Liberia. Musu is married with two children, ages 10 and 13; they live at home and are in school. Musu was unable to attend school, and for four years now she has been selling body cream, perfume and hair grease around her community and market. She started this business with small goods from her friend as sell-pay (to have the goods on credit, sells them and returns the principle) and she learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, perfume and hair grease for her business. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, perfume and hair grease for her business.

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is a youth client from Iraq. He is 27 years old, single and lives with his family consisting of 4 members, 2 of whom assist Mouhammad in providing the family income.

Mouhammad owns a small shop where he sells clothes for children. He established his business in 2011 and has gained good experience in this field. Mouhammad now has an employee and has gained an excellent reputation in his surrounding area thanks to his affordable prices.

Mouhammad is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his shop. By this loan, Mouhammad aims to continue to grow and improve his business and be able to provide his parents better living standards.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Nidaa

texts.en: Nidaa is a 25-years-old woman from Gaza. She is married and has 4 children. Three of her children go to school. Nidaa has owned a grocery store since January 2011 and she has one employee. She has asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a glass door and some goods for her grocery store. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase sales and thus improve her family's income.

loans.use: to buy a glass door and some goods for the grocery store.

loans.name: Viebeth Joy

texts.en:
Viebeth Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling cashew nuts in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of cashew nuts to sell.

Viebeth Joy has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from her general store.

Viebeth Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 51-year-old married client from Iraq who has three children. Ahmad works hard to provide his family’s income all by himself.

Ahmad owns a grocery store where he sells all the basic needs of a family like dairy products, canned food, snacks, soft drinks and detergents. He has been in this field since 1999 and has gained good experience.  Now, Ahmad has a hired employee and is well-known in his surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Ahmad is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD to install a display window for his grocery store. Ahmad is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide his family better living standards.

loans.use: to install a display window for his grocery store

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 44 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital City of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber plantations in Liberia. She is married with four children aged between 22 and 30. 

Hawa did not go to school, but she has been engaged in a business to help herself and her family. For the past ten years she has been selling rice by the cup, peppers, oil, etc. in the local market. She started this business with a small amount of money given to her by her husband, and she learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice by the bag, peppers, oil, etc. for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice by the bag, peppers, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 55 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school. She sells bananas in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She earns additional income from selling cashews.

Nimfa is requesting a loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional bananas to sell. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to sell.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 33 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County in Liberia. She is single with two children, ages 6 and 11, who are in school. She did not go to school. 

For five years now she has been selling kool-aid and cold water in the local market. She started this business with a little money from her fiancee, and she learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase a cooler, water, and kool-aid for her business. She plans to improve her children's future by educating them and building a house.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler, water, and kool-aid for her business.

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has two children. Mouhammad works hard to provide his family with an income, while his wife takes care of their children.

Mouhammad owns a small shop where he irons cloths. He gained his work experience through previously working as an employee at a similar shop for several years. In 2011, Mouhammad established his own business, and now he has an employee. He is gradually gaining the respect of his neighborhood, thanks to the good quality of his offered service.

Mouhammad is requesting a loan of $1,800 loan to buy a unique washing machine, customized for his use. Mouhammad is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide for his family’s need and be able to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy a unique washing machine, customized for his use.

loans.name: Moutasam

texts.en:
Moutasam is a married Iraqi client, who is 35 years old and a father of one child. 

Moutasam owns a bakery and specializes in baking bread for individuals, hotels and restaurants. He has been running this business since 2007, and it has been rapidly growing. Now Moutasam has two employees and has been gaining fame and respect in his neighborhood.

Moutasam is requesting a loan of $3,000. He will use this loan to renovate his bakery and to increase his inventory of flour and oil to increase his production. Through this loan, Moutasam aims to successfully grow his business, increase his profits and provide his family with better conditions and a brighter future.

loans.use: to renovate his bakery and to increase his inventory of flour and oil.

loans.name: Daniel's Group

texts.en:
Daniel's group is made up of three traders who are into the sales of jewelry, water tanks, soap and cream.

Daniel is 48 years old. He lives in Teshie with his wife Kate and three children, who are going to school. Daniel requested a loan of GHS 300 to inject into his jewelry business.

This is his third loan with ID-Ghana, and he, together with Boga and Margaret, needs a total of GHS 1,000 to be able to buy enough to sell to their customers.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Ragheb

texts.en:
Ragheb is a 40-year-old client from Iraq. He is married and has three children. Ragheb works hard to provide his family income, all by himself.

Ragheb owns a grocery store where he sells all the basic needs of a family, such as canned food, dairy products, soft drinks, snacks, and detergents. He has been in this business since 2010 and has gained good experience. Ragheb is now well-known in his neighborhood, with an excellent reputation.

Ragheb is requesting a loan of USD 3,000. He will use this loan to renovate his grocery store by installing a new floor and to increase his food inventory to sell. Ragheb is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so that he may be able to provide better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store by installing a new floor and to increase his food inventory to sell.

loans.name: Tuungane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mushonga est  conseillère  du  groupement d’affaire Tuungane, entrepreneur expérimentée,  âgée de 51 ans, veuve et mère de 7 enfants dont 2 n’étudient pas suite aux charges familiales multiples.
